metadata.title: CVE-2018-18343 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect handing of paths leading to a use after free in Skia in GoogleChrome prior to 71.0.3578.80 allowed a remote attacker to potentiallyexploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18343` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
